selectors.name: :host
selectors.prose: The :host pseudo-class, when evaluated in the context of a shadow tree, matches the shadow treeâ€™s shadow host. In any other context, it matches nothing.

selectors.name: :host-context()
selectors.prose: The :host-context() functional pseudo-class tests whether there is an ancestor, outside the shadow tree, which matches a particular selector. Its syntax is:

selectors.name: ::slotted()
selectors.prose: The ::slotted() pseudo-element represents the elements assigned, after flattening, to a slot. This pseudo-element only exists on slots.
